
Name: CVE-1999-0133
Status: Entry
Reference: CERT:CA-96.18.fm_fls
Reference: XF:fmaker-logfile

fm_fls license server for Adobe Framemaker allows local users to
overwrite arbitrary files and gain root access.

======================================================
Name: CVE-1999-1576
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-1999-1576
Phase: Assigned (20050421)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:19990924 Several ActiveX Buffer Overruns
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/28719
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#25919
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/25919
Reference: BID:666
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/666
Reference: XF:adobe-acrobat-pdf-bo(3318)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/3318

Buffer overflow in Adobe Acrobat ActiveX control (pdf.ocx,
PDF.PdfCtrl.1) 1.3.188 for Acrobat Reader 4.0 allows remote attackers
to execute arbitrary code via the pdf.setview method.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2000-0713
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2000-0713
Phase: Proposed (20000921)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20000726 [SPSadvisory#39]Adobe Acrobat Series PDF File Buffer Overflow
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2000-07/0382.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/misc/pdfsecurity.html
Reference: BID:1509
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/1509

Buffer overflow in Adobe Acrobat 4.05, Reader, Business Tools, and
Fill In products that handle PDF files allows attackers to execute
arbitrary commands via a long /Registry or /Ordering specifier.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(4) Baker, Cole, Levy, Wall
   NOOP(1) Christey

Voter Comments:
 Christey> ADDREF XF:adobe-pdf-bo(5002)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-1069
Status: Entry
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20010822 Adobe Acrobat creates world writable ~/AdobeFnt.lst files
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=99849121502399&w=2
Reference: MISC:http://lists.debian.org/debian-security/2001/debian-security-200101/msg00085.html
Reference: BID:3225
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/3225
Reference: XF:adobe-acrobat-insecure-permissions(7024)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/7024

libCoolType library as used in Adobe Acrobat (acroread) on Linux
creates the AdobeFnt.lst file with world-writable permissions, which
allows local users to modify the file and possibly modify acroread's
behavior.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-0030
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-0030
Phase: Assigned (20020116)
Category: SF
Reference: FULLDISC:20030324 Vulnerability (critical): Digital signature for Adobe Acrobat/Reader plug-in can be forged
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2003-March/004230.html
Reference: VULNWATCH:20030324 Vulnerability (critical): Digital signature for Adobe Acrobat/Reader plug-in can be forged
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/vulnwatch/2003-q1/0148.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#549913
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/549913
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/JSHA-5EZQGZ

The digital signature mechanism for the Adobe Acrobat PDF viewer only
verifies the PE header of executable code for a plug-in, which can
allow attackers to execute arbitrary code in certified mode by making
the plug-in appear to be signed by Adobe.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1016
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1016
Phase: Modified (20050319)
Category: SF
Reference: FULLDISC:20020719 Vulnerability found: Adobe Acrobat eBook Reader and Content Server
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2002-July/000177.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#438867
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/438867
Reference: BID:5273
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/5273
Reference: XF:adobe-ebook-bypass-restrictions(9634)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/9634.php

Adobe eBook Reader allows a user to bypass restrictions for copy,
print, lend, and give operations by backing up key data files,
performing the operations, and restoring the original data files.


Current Votes:
   NOOP(4) Cole, Cox, Foat, Wall



======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1017
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1017
Phase: Proposed (20020830)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020730 Vulnerability: protected Adobe eBooks can be copied between computers
Reference: URL:http://online.securityfocus.com/archive/1/285093
Reference: XF:adobe-ebook-bypass-activation(9740)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/9740.php
Reference: BID:5358
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/5358

Adobe eBook Reader 2.1 and 2.2 allows a user to copy eBooks to other
systems by using the backup feature, capturing the encryption
Challenge, and using the appropriate hash function to generate the
activation code.


Current Votes:
   NOOP(4) Cole, Cox, Foat, Wall



======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1018
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1018
Phase: Proposed (20020830)
Category: SF
Reference: VULNWATCH:20020712 [VulnWatch] Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library (fwd)
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/vulnwatch/2002-q3/0020.html
Reference: VULN-DEV:20020712 Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=vuln-dev&m=102649215618643&w=2
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020712 Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=vuln-dev&m=102650064028760&w=2

The library feature for Adobe Content Server 3.0 does not verify if a
customer has already checked out an eBook, which allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) by
checking out the same book multiple times.


Current Votes:
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(4) Cole, Cox, Foat, Wall

Voter Comments:
 Frech> XF:adobe-content-library-dos(10383)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1019
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1019
Phase: Proposed (20020830)
Category: SF
Reference: VULNWATCH:20020712 [VulnWatch] Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library (fwd)
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/vulnwatch/2002-q3/0020.html
Reference: VULN-DEV:20020712 Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=vuln-dev&m=102649215618643&w=2
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020712 Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=vuln-dev&m=102650064028760&w=2

The library feature for Adobe Content Server 3.0 allows a remote
attacker to check out an eBook for an arbitrary length of time via a
modified loanMin parameter to download.asp.

   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(4) Cole, Cox, Foat, Wall

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1020
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1020
Phase: Proposed (20020830)
Category: SF
Reference: VULNWATCH:20020712 [VulnWatch] Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library (fwd)
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/vulnwatch/2002-q3/0020.html
Reference: VULN-DEV:20020712 Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=vuln-dev&m=102649215618643&w=2
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020712 Vulnerability found: The Adobe eBook Library
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=vuln-dev&m=102650064028760&w=2

The library feature for Adobe Content Server 3.0 allows a remote
attacker to check out an eBook even when the maximum number of loans
is exceeded by accessing the "Add to bookbag" feature when the server
reports that no more copies are available.


Current Votes:
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(4) Cole, Cox, Foat, Wall

Voter Comments:
 Frech> XF:adobe-content-bypass-loan(10385)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1601
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1601
Phase: Assigned (20050320)
Category: SF
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/AAMN-56LQ2J
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#116875
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/116875
Reference: BID:4106
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/4106
Reference: XF:adobe-photodeluxe-execute-java(8210)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/8210

The Connectables feature in Adobe PhotoDeluxe 3.1 prepends the Adobe
directory to the CLASSPATH environment variable, which allows applets
to run with higher privileges and remote attackers to gain privileges
via an HTML e-mail message or a web page.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2003-0142
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2003-0142
Phase: Assigned (20030313)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20030708 Adobe Acrobat and PDF security: no improvements for 2 years
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/328224
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#689835
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/689835

Adobe Acrobat Reader (acroread) 6, under certain circumstances when
running with the "Certified plug-ins only" option disabled, loads
plug-ins with signatures used for older versions of Acrobat, which can
allow attackers to cause Acrobat to enter Certified mode and run
untrusted plugins by modifying the CTIsCertifiedMode function.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2003-0284
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2003-0284
Phase: Assigned (20030513)
Category: SF
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/downloads/detail.jsp?ftpID=2121
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#184820
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/184820

Adobe Acrobat 5 does not properly validate JavaScript in PDF files,
which allows remote attackers to write arbitrary files into the
Plug-ins folder that spread to other PDF documents, as demonstrated by
the W32.Yourde virus.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2004-0194
Status: Entry
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20040303 Abobe Reader 5.1 XFDF Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=107842545022724&w=2
Reference: FULLDISC:20040303 Adobe Acrobat Reader XML Forms Data Format Buffer Overflow
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2004-March/018227.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.nextgenss.com/advisories/adobexfdf.txt
Reference: BID:9802
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9802
Reference: XF:acrobatreader-xfdf-bo(15384)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/15384
Reference: OSVDB:4135
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/4135

Stack-based buffer overflow in the OutputDebugString function for
Adobe Acrobat Reader 5.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code via a PDF document with XML Forms Data Format (XFDF) data.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2004-0629
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2004-0629
Phase: Assigned (20040707)
Category: SF
Reference: IDEFENSE:20040813 Adobe Acrobat/Acrobat Reader ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=126&type=vulnerabilities
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/techdocs/330527.html
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-200408-14
Reference: URL:http://www.gentoo.org/security/en/glsa/glsa-200408-14.xml
Reference: BID:10947
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/10947
Reference: XF:acrobat-reader-activex-bo(16998)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/16998

Buffer overflow in the ActiveX component (pdf.ocx) for Adobe Acrobat
5.0.5 and Acrobat Reader, and possibly other versions, allows remote
attackers to execute arbitrary code via a URI for a PDF file with a
null terminator (%00) followed by a long string.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2004-0630
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2004-0630
Phase: Assigned (20040707)
Category: SF
Reference: IDEFENSE:20040812 Adobe Acrobat Reader (Unix) Shell Metacharacter Code Execution Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=124&type=vulnerabilities
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/techdocs/322914.html
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-200408-14
Reference: URL:http://security.gentoo.org/glsa/glsa-200408-14.xml
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2004:432
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2004-432.html
Reference: BID:10931
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/10931
Reference: XF:acrobat-reader-execute-code(16973)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/16973

The uudecoding feature in Adobe Acrobat Reader 5.0.5 and 5.0.6 for
Unix and Linux, and possibly other versions including those before
5.0.9, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via shell
metacharacters ("`" or backtick) in the filename of the PDF file that
is provided to the uudecode command.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2004-0631
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2004-0631
Phase: Assigned (20040707)
Category: SF
Reference: IDEFENSE:20040812 Adobe Acrobat Reader (Unix) 5.0 Uudecode Filename Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=125&type=vulnerabilities
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/techdocs/322914.html
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-200408-14
Reference: URL:http://security.gentoo.org/glsa/glsa-200408-14.xml

Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2004-432.html

Reference: XF:adobe-acrobat-uudecode-bo(16972)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/16972

Buffer overflow in the uudecoding feature for Adobe Acrobat Reader
5.0.5 and 5.0.6 for Unix and Linux, and possibly other versions
including those before 5.0.9, allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code via a long filename for the PDF file that is provided
to the uudecode command.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2004-0632
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2004-0632
Phase: Assigned (20040707)
Category: SF
Reference: IDEFENSE:20040712 Adobe Reader 6.0 Filename Handler Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=116&type=vulnerabilities
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/techdocs/330527.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.adobe.com/support/techdocs/34222.htm
Reference: XF:adobe-acrobat-null-bo(16667)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/16667

Adobe Reader 6.0 does not properly handle null characters when
splitting a filename path into components, which allows remote
attackers to execute arbitrary code via a file with a long extension
that is not normally handled by Reader, triggering a buffer overflow.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2004-1153
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2004-1153
Phase: Assigned (20041207)
Category: SF
Reference: IDEFENSE:20041214 Adobe Reader 6.0 .ETD File Format String Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=163&type=vulnerabilities
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/downloads/detail.jsp?ftpID=2679

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:2919
Reference: XF:adobe-acrobat-etd-format-string(18478)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/18478

Format string vulnerability in Adobe Acrobat Reader 6.0.0 through
6.0.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via an .ETD
document containing format string specifiers in (1) title or (2)
baseurl fields.

Name: CVE-2005-0151
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-0151
Phase: Assigned (20050125)
Category: SF

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/15255

The NPSVG3.dll ActiveX control for Adobe SVG Viewer 3.02 and earlier,
when running on Internet Explorer, allows remote attackers to
determine the existence of arbitrary files by setting the src property
to the target filename and using Javascript to determine if the web
page immediately stops loading, which indicates whether the file
exists or not.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-1347
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-1347
Phase: Assigned (20050428)
Category: SF
Reference: MISC:http://www.alphahackers.com/advisories/acrobat6.txt
Reference: BID:13265
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/13265
Reference: OSVDB:15850
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/15850
Reference: SECTRACK:1013774
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1013774
Reference: XF:acrobat-reader-invalid-id-handle-bo(20216)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/20216

** UNVERIFIABLE **

NOTE: this issue describes a problem that can not be independently
verified as of 20050421.  Adobe Acrobat reader (AcroRd32.exe) 6.0 and
earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
("Invalid-ID-Handle-Error" error) and modify memory beginning at a
particular address, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code,
via a crafted PDF file.  NOTE: the vendor has stated that the reporter
refused to provide sufficient details to confirm the issue.  In
addition, due to the lack of details in the original advisory, an
independent verification is not possible.  Finally, the reliability of
the original reporter is unknown.  This item has only been assigned a
CVE identifier for tracking purposes, and to serve as a concrete
example of the newly defined UNVERIFIABLE and PRERELEASE content
decisions in CVE, which must be discussed by the Editorial Board.
Without additional details or independent verification by reliable
sources, it is highly likely that this item will be REJECTED.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

CS2, and (3) Adobe Help Center, install a large number of .EXE and

allows local users to gain privileges via Trojan horse programs.

Adobe Graphics Server 2.0 and 2.1 (formerly AlterCast) and Adobe
Document Server (ADS) 5.0 and 6.0 allows local users to read files
with certain extensions or overwrite arbitrary files and execute code
via a crafted SOAP request to the AlterCast web service in which the
request uses the (1) saveContent or (2) saveOptimized ADS commands, or
the (3) loadContent command.

Name: CVE-2006-1785

Reference: MISC:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2005-68/advisory/

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/17500

Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/1342
Reference: OSVDB:24588
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/24588

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/15924
Reference: XF:adobe-readerurl-xss(25770)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/25770

Adobe Document Server for Reader Extensions 6.0 allows remote
authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script via a leading (1)
ftp or (2) http URI in the ReaderURL variable in the "Update Download
Site" section of ads-readerext.  NOTE: it is not clear whether the
vendor advisory addresses this issue.  In addition, since the issue
requires administrative privileges to exploit, it is not clear whether
this crosses security boundaries.

denial of service via unspecified vectors, including a large
tdir_count value in the TIFFFetchShortPair function in tif_dirread.c.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: XF:flashplayer-multiple-xsrf(29634)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/29634

CRLF injection vulnerability in Adobe Flash Player plugin 9.0.16 and
earlier for Windows, 7.0.63 and earlier for Linux, 7.x before 7.0 r67
for Solaris, and before 9.0.28.0 for Mac OS X, allows remote attackers
to modify HTTP headers of client requests and conduct HTTP Request
Splitting attacks via CRLF sequences in arguments to the ActionScript
functions (1) XML.addRequestHeader and (2) XML.contentType.  NOTE: the
flexibility of the attack varies depending on the type of web browser
being used.

Reference: BUGTRAQ:20061024 Re: adobe php sdk Remote File Include Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/449616/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20061024 adobe php sdk Remote File Include Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/449576/100/0/threaded
Reference: SREASON:1784
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/1784
Reference: XF:adobe-php-sdk-cachedgateway-file-include(29776)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/29776

** DISPUTED **

PHP remote file inclusion vulnerability in
libraries/amfphp/amf-core/custom/CachedGateway.php in Adobe PHP SDK
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via the
AMFPHP_BASE parameter.  NOTE: this issue has been disputed by a
third-party researcher who states that AMFPHP_BASE is a constant.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Adobe ColdFusion MX7 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive
information via a URL request (1) for a non-existent (a) JWS, (b) CFM,
(c) CFML, or (d) CFC file, which displays the installation path in the
resulting error message; or (2) to /CFIDE/administrator/login.cfm
without a host, which can reveal the server's internal IP address in
an HREF tag.

Reference: BID:21532
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/21532
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-4949
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/4949

Reference: XF:coldfusion-path-xss(30841)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/30841

Adobe ColdFusion MX 7.x before 7.0.2 does not properly filter HTML
tags when protecting against cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, which
allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a
NULL byte (%00) in certain HTML tags, as demonstrated using
"%00script" in a tag.

Reference: SREASON:2090
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2090
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2898
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2898
Reference: XF:adobe-acrobat-pdf-xss(31271)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/31271

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Adobe Acrobat
Reader Plugin before 8.0.0, and possibly the plugin distributed with
Adobe Reader 7.x before 7.1.4, 8.x before 8.1.7, and 9.x before 9.2,
for Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1, Google Chrome,
Opera 8.5.4 build 770, and Opera 9.10.8679 on Windows allow remote
attackers to inject arbitrary JavaScript and conduct other attacks via
a .pdf URL with a javascript: or res: URI with (1) FDF, (2) XML, and
(3) XFDF AJAX parameters, or (4) an arbitrarily named name=URI anchor
identifier, aka "Universal XSS (UXSS)."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

8.0.0, as used in Mozilla Firefox 1.5.0.7, allows remote attackers to

to document.write in the (1) FDF, (2) XML, or (3) XFDF AJAX request
parameters.

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/31291

CRLF injection vulnerability in Adobe Acrobat Reader Plugin before
8.0.0, when used with the Microsoft.XMLHTTP ActiveX object in Internet
Explorer, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and
conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via CRLF sequences in the
javascript: URI in the (1) FDF, (2) XML, or (3) XFDF AJAX request
parameters.

Integer overflow in Adobe Flash Player 9.0.115.0 and earlier, and
8.0.39.0 and earlier, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code via a crafted SWF file with a negative Scene Count value, which
passes a signed comparison, is used as an offset of a NULL pointer,
and triggers a buffer overflow.

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/22856
Reference: XF:adobe-acropdf-dos(32896)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/32896

AcroPDF.DLL in Adobe Reader 8.0, when accessed from Mozilla Firefox,
Netscape, or Opera, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
service (unspecified resource consumption) via a .pdf URL with an
anchor identifier that begins with search= followed by many %n
sequences, a different vulnerability than CVE-2006-6027 and
CVE-2006-6236.

a signed comparison of values that are assumed to be non-negative.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-3640
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-3640
Phase: Assigned (20070709)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070703 Security on AIR: Local file access through JavaScript
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/472733/100/0/threaded
Reference: OSVDB:41473
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/41473
Reference: OSVDB:41474
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/41474
Reference: SREASON:2882
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2882

Adobe Integrated Runtime (AIR, aka Apollo) allows context-dependent
attackers to modify arbitrary files within an executing .air file
(compiled AIR application) and perform cross-site scripting (XSS)
attacks, as demonstrated by an application that modifies an HTML file
inside itself via JavaScript that uses an APPEND open operation and
the writeUTFBytes function.  NOTE: this may be an intended consequence
of the AIR permission model; if so, then perhaps this issue should not
be included in CVE.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/484186/100/0/threaded
Reference: MS:MS07-061
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/MS07-061.mspx
Reference: MSKB:943521
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/advisory/943521.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA07-317A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA07-317A.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#403150
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/403150
Reference: BID:25945
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/25945
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:4581
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:4581
Reference: SECTRACK:1018822
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1018822
Reference: SECTRACK:1018831
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1018831
Reference: SECUNIA:26201
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/26201

The URL handling in Shell32.dll in the Windows shell in Microsoft
Windows XP and Server 2003, with Internet Explorer 7 installed, allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary programs via invalid "%"
sequences in a mailto: or other URI handler, as demonstrated using
mIRC, Outlook, Firefox, Adobe Reader, Skype, and other applications.
NOTE: this issue might be related to other issues involving URL
handlers in Windows systems, such as CVE-2007-3845. There also might
be separate but closely related issues in the applications that are
invoked by the handlers.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2995

ActionScript 3 (AS3) in Adobe Flash Player 9.0.47.0, and other
versions and other 9.0.124.0 and earlier versions, allows remote
attackers to bypass the Security Sandbox Model, obtain sensitive
information, and port scan arbitrary hosts via a Flash (SWF) movie
that specifies a connection to make, then uses timing discrepancies
from the SecurityErrorEvent error to determine whether a port is open
or not.  NOTE: 9.0.115.0 introduces support for a workaround, but does
not fix the vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2007-5145

Reference: OSVDB:41064
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/41064
Reference: OSVDB:41065
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/41065

Multiple buffer overflows in system DLL files in Microsoft Windows XP,
as used by Microsoft Windows Explorer (explorer.exe) 6.00.2900.2180,
Don Ho Notepad++, unspecified Adobe Macromedia applications, and other
programs, allow user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of
service (application crash) via long strings in the (1) author, (2)
title, (3) subject, and (4) comment Properties fields of a file,
possibly involving improper handling of extended file attributes by
the (a) NtQueryInformationFile, (b) NtQueryDirectoryFile, (c)
NtSetInformationFile, (d) FileAllInformation, (e) FileNameInformation,
and other FILE_INFORMATION_CLASS functions in ntdll.dll and the (f)
GetFileAttributesExW and (g) GetFileAttributesW functions in
kernel32.dll, a related issue to CVE-2007-1347.

Reference: SECUNIA:30507
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30507

The Adobe Macromedia Flash 9 plug-in allows remote attackers to cause
a victim machine to establish TCP sessions with arbitrary hosts via a
Flash (SWF) movie, related to lack of pinning of a hostname to a
single IP address after receiving an allow-access-from element in a
cross-domain-policy XML document, and the availability of a Flash
Socket class that does not use the browser's DNS pins, aka DNS
rebinding attacks, a different issue than CVE-2002-1467 and
CVE-2007-4324.

to 7.0.70.0, when running on Linux, uses insecure permissions for
memory, which might allow local users to gain privileges.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Request Forgery (CSRF) style attacks by using the Flash navigateToURL
function to send a SOAP message to a UPnP control point, as
demonstrated by changing the primary DNS server.

History Management feature in Adobe Flex 3.0.1 SDK and Flex Builder 3,
and generated applications, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary
web script or HTML via the anchor identifier to (1)
client-side-detection-with-history/history/historyFrame.html, (2)
express-installation-with-history/history/historyFrame.html, or (3)
no-player-detection-with-history/history/historyFrame.html in
templates/html-templates/.  NOTE: Firefox 2.0 and possibly other
browsers prevent exploitation.

in August 2008.

time, as demonstrated by two responses that provide SWF files with
different SWF version numbers.

Name: CVE-2008-5361
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5361
Phase: Assigned (20081207)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081122 Adobe Flash Multiple Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/498561/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb08-22.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.isecpartners.com/advisories/2008-01-flash.txt
Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.avaya.com/elmodocs2/security/ASA-2009-020.htm
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-200903-23
Reference: URL:http://security.gentoo.org/glsa/glsa-200903-23.xml
Reference: SUNALERT:248586
Reference: URL:http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-26-248586-1
Reference: SECUNIA:33390
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/33390
Reference: SECUNIA:34226
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/34226
Reference: SREASON:4692
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4692

The ActionScript 2 virtual machine in Adobe Flash Player 10.x before
10.0.12.36 and 9.x before 9.0.151.0, and Adobe AIR before 1.5, does
not verify a member element's size when performing (1)
DefineConstantPool, (2) ActionJump, (3) ActionPush, (4) ActionTry, and
unspecified other actions, which allows remote attackers to read
sensitive data from process memory via a crafted PDF file.

Reference: SREASON:4692
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4692

The DefineConstantPool action in the ActionScript 2 virtual machine in
Adobe Flash Player 10.x before 10.0.12.36 and 9.x before 9.0.151.0,
and Adobe AIR before 1.5, accepts an untrusted input value for a
"constant count," which allows remote attackers to read sensitive data
from process memory via a crafted PDF file.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5363
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5363
Phase: Assigned (20081207)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081122 Adobe Flash Multiple Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/498561/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb08-22.html

Reference: URL:http://security.gentoo.org/glsa/glsa-200903-23.xml
Reference: SUNALERT:248586

Reference: SECUNIA:34226
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/34226
Reference: SREASON:4692
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4692

The ActionScript 2 virtual machine in Adobe Flash Player 10.x before
10.0.12.36 and 9.x before 9.0.151.0, and Adobe AIR before 1.5, does
not validate character elements during retrieval from the dictionary
data structure, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a crafted
PDF file.

Acrobat 7 before 7.1.3, Adobe Reader 8 and Acrobat 8 before 8.1.6, and
Adobe Reader 9 and Acrobat 9 before 9.1.2 allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly execute
arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file that contains JBIG2 text region
segments with Huffman encoding.

Reference: XF:reader-getannots-code-execution(50145)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/50145

The getAnnots Doc method in the JavaScript API in Adobe Reader and
Acrobat 9.1, 8.1.4, 7.1.1, and earlier allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or execute arbitrary
code via a PDF file that contains an annotation, and has an OpenAction
entry with JavaScript code that calls this method with crafted integer
arguments.

The customDictionaryOpen spell method in the JavaScript API in Adobe
Reader 9.1, 8.1.4, 7.1.1, and earlier on Linux and UNIX allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or execute
arbitrary code via a PDF file that triggers a call to this method with
a long string in the second argument.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-1597
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-1597
Phase: Assigned (20090511)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090503 [SecNiche WhitePaper ] - PDF Silent HTTP Form Repurposing Attacks
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/503183/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://secniche.org/papers/SNS_09_03_PDF_Silent_Form_Re_Purp_Attack.pdf

Mozilla Firefox executes DOM calls in response to a javascript: URI in
the target attribute of a submit element within a form contained in an
inline PDF file, which might allow remote attackers to bypass intended
Adobe Acrobat JavaScript restrictions on accessing the document
object, as demonstrated by a web site that permits PDF uploads by
untrusted users, and therefore has a shared document.domain between
the web site and this javascript: URI.  NOTE: the researcher reports
that Adobe's position is "a PDF file is active content."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Multiple heap-based buffer overflows in Adobe Reader 7 and Acrobat 7
before 7.1.3, Adobe Reader 8 and Acrobat 8 before 8.1.6, and Adobe
Reader 9 and Acrobat 9 before 9.1.2 might allow remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application
crash) via a crafted PDF file with a JPX (aka JPEG2000) stream that
triggers heap memory corruption.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

code via an AVM2 file with a large intrf_count value that triggers a
dereference of an out-of-bounds pointer.

ColdFusion Server 8.0.1, 8, and earlier allow remote attackers to
inject arbitrary web script or HTML via (1) the startRow parameter to

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/35740

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5719
Reference: SECTRACK:1023007
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023007
Reference: SECUNIA:35930
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/35930
Reference: SECUNIA:36331
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/36331
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1969
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1969
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2898
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2898
Reference: XF:getplus-nos-insecure-permissions(54383)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/54383

NOS Microsystems getPlus Download Manager, as used in Adobe Reader
1.6.2.36 and possibly other versions, Corel getPlus Download Manager
before 1.5.0.48, and possibly other products, installs
NOS\bin\getPlus_HelperSvc.exe with insecure permissions (Everyone:Full
Control), which allows local users to gain SYSTEM privileges by
replacing getPlus_HelperSvc.exe with a Trojan horse program, as
demonstrated by use of getPlus Download Manager within Adobe
Reader. NOTE: within Adobe Reader, the scope of this issue is limited
because the program is deleted and the associated service is not
automatically launched after a successful installation and reboot.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/36664
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5822
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5822
Reference: SECTRACK:1023007
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023007
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2898
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2898

The JavaScript for Acrobat API in Adobe Reader and Acrobat 7.x before
7.1.4, 8.x before 8.1.7, and 9.x before 9.2 does not properly
implement the (1) Privileged Context and (2) Safe Path restrictions
for unspecified JavaScript methods, which allows remote attackers to
create arbitrary files, and possibly execute arbitrary code, via the
cPath parameter in a crafted PDF file.  NOTE: some of these details are
obtained from third party information.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/36467

Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in the RoboHelpServer Servlet
(robohelp/server) in Adobe RoboHelp Server 8 allows remote attackers
to execute arbitrary code by uploading a Java Archive (.jsp) file
during a PUBLISH action, then accessing it via a direct request to the
file in the robohelp/robo/reserved/web directory under its sessionid
subdirectory, as demonstrated by the vd_adobe module in VulnDisco Pack
Professional 8.7 through 8.11.

Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2798
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2798

Adobe Photoshop Elements 8.0 installs the Adobe Active File Monitor V8
service with an insecure security descriptor, which allows local users
to (1) stop the service via the stop command, (2) execute arbitrary
commands as SYSTEM by using the config command to modify the binPath
variable, or (3) restart the service via the start command.

data stream, which triggers an integer sign extension that bypasses a
sanity check, leading to memory corruption.

allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) an
unspecified block type in a Shockwave file, leading to a heap-based
buffer overflow; and might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code via (2) an unspecified 3D block in a Shockwave file, leading to
memory corruption; or (3) a crafted 3D model in a Shockwave file,
leading to heap memory corruption.

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:7182

Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023651

A certain ActiveX control in NOS Microsystems getPlus Download Manager
(aka DLM or Downloader) 1.5.2.35, as used in Adobe Download Manager,
improperly validates requests involving web sites that are not in
subdomains, which allows remote attackers to force the download and
installation of arbitrary programs via a crafted name for a download
site.

in the Launch File warning dialog, which makes it easier for remote

that claims that the Open button will enable the user to read an
encrypted message.

Windows and Mac OS X, allow attackers to execute arbitrary code via a
PDF file with crafted Flash content, involving the newfunction (0x44)

corruption, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-1285 and
CVE-2010-2201.

9.0.277.0 and 10.x before 10.1.53.64, and Adobe AIR before
2.0.2.12610, when Firefox or Chrome is used, allows remote attackers
to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors related
to URL parsing.

Reference: XF:adobe-fpair-memory-code-exec(59337)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/59337

Adobe Flash Player before 9.0.277.0 and 10.x before 10.1.53.64, and
Adobe AIR before 2.0.2.12610, allows attackers to cause a denial of
service (memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code by
calling the ActionScript native object 2200 connect method multiple
times with different arguments, a different vulnerability than
CVE-2010-2160, CVE-2010-2165, CVE-2010-2166, CVE-2010-2171,
CVE-2010-2175, CVE-2010-2176, CVE-2010-2177, CVE-2010-2178,
CVE-2010-2180, CVE-2010-2182, CVE-2010-2184, and CVE-2010-2187.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/41237

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6854
Reference: SECTRACK:1024159
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1024159
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-1636
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1636

Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.x before 9.3.3, and 8.x before 8.2.3 on
Windows and Mac OS X, allow attackers to execute arbitrary code via a
PDF file with crafted Flash content involving the (1) pushstring
(0x2C) operator, (2) debugfile (0xF1) operator, and an "invalid
pointer vulnerability" that triggers memory corruption, a different
vulnerability than CVE-2010-1285 and CVE-2010-2168.

Reference: MISC:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2010-113/
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb10-25.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12185
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12185
Reference: SECTRACK:1024664
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1024664

dirapi.dll in Adobe Shockwave Player before 11.5.9.615 allows remote
attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service
(memory corruption) via a Director file containing a crafted pamm
chunk with an invalid (1) size and (2) number of sub-chunks, a
different vulnerability than CVE-2010-4084, CVE-2010-4085,
CVE-2010-4086, and CVE-2010-4088.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2010-2582
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-2582
Phase: Assigned (20100701)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20101029 Secunia Research: Adobe Shockwave Player "DEMX" Chunk Parsing Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/514560/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2010-114/

Reference: SECTRACK:1024664
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1024664

An unspecified function in TextXtra.x32 in Adobe Shockwave Player
before 11.5.9.615 does not properly reallocate a buffer when
processing a DEMX chunk in a Director file, which allows remote
attackers to trigger a heap-based buffer overflow and execute
arbitrary code.

Category:

Reference: MISC:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-10-164
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb10-20.html

Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1024361
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-2176
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/2176

Adobe Shockwave Player before 11.5.8.612 does not properly validate
values associated with buffer-size calculation for a 0xFFFFFFF8 record
in a (1) .dir or (2) .dcr Director movie, which allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) or
execute arbitrary code via a crafted movie.

Acrobat 9.x before 9.4, and 8.x before 8.2.5 on Windows and Mac OS X,

service (application crash) via a PDF document with a long field in a
Smart INdependent Glyphlets (SING) table in a TTF font, as exploited
in the wild in September 2010. NOTE: some of these details are
obtained from third party information.

allows local users, and possibly remote attackers, to execute
arbitrary code and conduct DLL hijacking attacks via a Trojan horse
dwmapi.dll or Wintab32.dll that is located in the same folder as a PSD
or other file that is processed by PhotoShop.  NOTE: some of these
details are obtained from third party information.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-3653
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3653
Phase: Assigned (20100928)
Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:15296
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/15296
Reference: MISC:http://www.abysssec.com/blog/2010/10/adobe-shockwave-player-rcsl-chunk-memory-corruption-0day/
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb10-25.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#402231
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/402231
Reference: BID:44291
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/44291
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:11285
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:11285
Reference: SECTRACK:1024635
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1024635
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-2752
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/2752
Reference: XF:adobe-shockwave-rcsl-code-exec(62688)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/62688

The Director module (dirapi.dll) in Adobe Shockwave Player before
11.5.9.615 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause
a denial of service (memory corruption) via a Director movie with a
crafted rcsL chunk containing a field whose value is used as a pointer
offset, as exploited in the wild in October 2010. NOTE: some of these
details are obtained from third party information.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Windows, Mac OS X, Linux, and Solaris and 10.1.95.1 on Android, and
authplay.dll (aka AuthPlayLib.bundle or libauthplay.so.0.0.0) in Adobe
Reader and Acrobat 9.x through 9.4, allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and
application crash) via crafted SWF content, as exploited in the wild
in October 2010.

Name: CVE-2010-3975

Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100827 Flash Player 9 DLL Hijacking Exploit (schannel.dll)

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12212
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12212

Untrusted search path vulnerability in Adobe Flash Player 9 allows
local users, and possibly remote attackers, to execute arbitrary code
and conduct DLL hijacking attacks via a Trojan horse schannel.dll that
is located in the same folder as a file that is processed by Flash.

Untrusted search path vulnerability in Adobe Flash Player before
9.0.289.0 and 10.x before 10.1.102.64 on Windows allows local users,
and possibly remote attackers, to execute arbitrary code and conduct
DLL hijacking attacks via a Trojan horse dwmapi.dll that is located in
the same folder as a file that is processed by Flash Player.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-4188
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-4188
Phase: Assigned (20101105)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20110209 TPTI-11-01: Adobe Shockwave dirapi.dll IFWV Trusted Offset Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/516332/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://dvlabs.tippingpoint.com/advisory/TPTI-11-01
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb11-01.html
Reference: BID:46319
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/46319
Reference: SECTRACK:1025056
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1025056
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0335
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0335

The dirapi.dll module in Adobe Shockwave Player before 11.5.9.620
allows attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (memory corruption) via a Director movie with an IFWV chunk
with a size field of 0, which is used in the calculation of a file
offset and causes invalid data to be used as a loop counter,
triggering a heap-based buffer overflow, a different vulnerability
than CVE-2010-2587 and CVE-2010-2588.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2010-4190
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-4190
Phase: Assigned (20101105)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20110209 ZDI-11-080: Adobe Shockwave CSWV Chunk Substructure Offset Value Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/516324/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-11-080/
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb11-01.html
Reference: BID:46324
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/46324

Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1025056
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0335
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0335

Adobe Shockwave Player before 11.5.9.620 allows attackers to execute
arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a
Director movie with a crafted CSWV RIFF chunk that causes an incorrect
calculation of an offset for a substructure, wihch causes an
out-of-bounds "seek" of heap memory, a different vulnerability than
CVE-2011-0555, CVE-2010-4093, CVE-2010-4187, CVE-2010-4191,
CVE-2010-4192, and CVE-2010-4306.

Unspecified vulnerability in Adobe Flash Player 10.2.154.13 and
earlier on Windows, Mac OS X, Linux, and Solaris; 10.1.106.16 and
earlier on Android; Adobe AIR 2.5.1 and earlier; and Authplay.dll (aka
AuthPlayLib.bundle) in Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.x through 9.4.2 and
10.x through 10.0.1 on Windows and Mac OS X, allows remote attackers
to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application
crash) via crafted Flash content, as demonstrated by a .swf file
embedded in an Excel spreadsheet, and as exploited in the wild in
March 2011.

Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0923
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0924
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0924
Reference: XF:adobe-flash-swf-doc-ce(66681)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/66681

Adobe Flash Player before 10.2.154.27 on Windows, Mac OS X, Linux, and
Solaris and 10.2.156.12 and earlier on Android; Adobe AIR before
2.6.19140; and Authplay.dll (aka AuthPlayLib.bundle) in Adobe Reader
9.x before 9.4.4 and 10.x through 10.0.1 on Windows, Adobe Reader 9.x
before 9.4.4 and 10.x before 10.0.3 on Mac OS X, and Adobe Acrobat 9.x
before 9.4.4 and 10.x before 10.0.3 on Windows and Mac OS X allow
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (application crash) via crafted Flash content; as demonstrated
by a Microsoft Office document with an embedded .swf file that has a
size inconsistency in a "group of included constants," object type
confusion, ActionScript that adds custom functions to prototypes, and
Date objects; and as exploited in the wild in April 2011.

Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1025012

9.0.1 CHF1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or
HTML via an id parameter containing a JavaScript onLoad event handler
for a BODY element, related to a "tag body" attack.  NOTE: this was
originally reported as affecting 9.0.1 CHF1 and earlier.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-0736
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-0736
Phase: Assigned (20110201)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20110128 Vulnerabilities in Adobe ColdFusion
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2011-01/0537.html
Reference: MISC:http://websecurity.com.ua/4879/
Reference: OSVDB:70780
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/70780

** DISPUTED ** Adobe ColdFusion 9.0.1 CHF1 and earlier, when a web
application is configured to use a DBMS, allows remote attackers to
obtain potentially sensitive information about the database structure
via an id=- query to a .cfm file.  NOTE: the vendor disputes the
significance of this issue because the Site-wide Error Handler and
Debug Output Settings sections of the ColdFusion Lockdown guide
explain the requirement for settings that prevent this information
disclosure.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-0737
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-0737
Phase: Assigned (20110201)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20110128 Vulnerabilities in Adobe ColdFusion
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2011-01/0537.html
Reference: MISC:http://websecurity.com.ua/4879/
Reference: OSVDB:70781
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/70781

** DISPUTED ** Adobe ColdFusion 9.0.1 CHF1 and earlier allows remote
attackers to obtain sensitive information via an id=- query to a .cfm
file, which reveals the installation path in an error message.  NOTE:
the vendor disputes the significance of this issue because the
Site-wide Error Handler and Debug Output Settings sections of the
ColdFusion Lockdown guide explain the requirement for settings that
prevent this information disclosure.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

data, which allows attackers to have an unspecified impact via unknown
vectors, related to a "deserialization vulnerability."

Reference: IDEFENSE:20130108 Adobe Reader and Acrobat XSLT node() and lang() Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2013:0047
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2013-01/msg00005.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2013:0138
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2013-01/msg00028.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2013:0193
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2013-01/msg00081.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16094
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16094

Heap-based buffer overflow in the XSLT engine in Adobe Reader and
Acrobat 9.x before 9.5.3, 10.x before 10.1.5, and 11.x before 11.0.1
allows attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (memory corruption) via a PDF file containing an XSL file that
triggers memory corruption when the lang function processes XML data
with a crafted node-set.

CRLF injection vulnerability in the Component Browser in Adobe
ColdFusion 8.0 through 9.0.1 allows remote attackers to inject
arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via
unspecified vectors.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Phase: Assigned (20120402)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20120510 Adobe Photoshop CS5.1 U3D.8BI Library Collada Asset Elements Stack Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2012/May/58
Reference: MISC:http://retrogod.altervista.org/9sg_photoshock_adv.htm
Reference: MISC:http://retrogod.altervista.org/9sg_photoshock_u3d.htm

Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/show/osvdb/81832
Reference: SECUNIA:49160
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/49160

Stack-based buffer overflow in the U3D.8BI library plugin in Adobe
Photoshop CS5 12.x before 12.0.5 and CS5.1 12.1.x before 12.1.1 allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long Collada asset
element in a DAE file, as demonstrated by the cameraYFov value in the
contributor comments element.

Reference: SECUNIA:50737
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/50737

Integer overflow in plug-ins/common/psd.c in the Adobe Photoshop PSD
plugin in GIMP 2.2.13 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted
channels header value in a PSD image file, which triggers a heap-based
buffer overflow, a different vulnerability than CVE-2009-3909.

Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-4159
Phase: Assigned (20120807)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb12-16.html
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201308-03

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16346

Windows and Mac OS X allow attackers to execute arbitrary code or
cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via unspecified vectors,
a different vulnerability than CVE-2012-2051, CVE-2012-4147,
CVE-2012-4148, CVE-2012-4149, CVE-2012-4150, CVE-2012-4151,
CVE-2012-4152, CVE-2012-4153, CVE-2012-4154, CVE-2012-4155,
CVE-2012-4156, CVE-2012-4157, CVE-2012-4158, and CVE-2012-4160.

Windows, before 10.3.183.48 and 11.x before 11.5.502.136 on Mac OS X,
before 10.3.183.48 and 11.x before 11.2.202.258 on Linux, before
11.1.111.29 on Android 2.x and 3.x, and before 11.1.115.34 on Android
4.x; Adobe AIR before 3.5.0.880 on Windows and before 3.5.0.890 on Mac
OS X; and Adobe AIR SDK before 3.5.0.880 on Windows and before
3.5.0.890 on Mac OS X allow attackers to execute arbitrary code or
cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via unspecified vectors.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2012-6637
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-6637
Phase: Assigned (20140207)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20140124 Security Vulnerabilities in Apache Cordova / PhoneGap
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2014/Jan/96
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20140207 Re: CVE request: multiple issues in Apache Cordova/PhoneGap
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/02/07/9
Reference: MISC:http://labs.mwrinfosecurity.com/blog/2012/04/30/building-android-javajavascript-bridges/
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/124954/apachecordovaphonegap-bypass.txt
Reference: MISC:http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~shmat/shmat_ndss14nofrak.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://www.internetsociety.org/ndss2014/programme#session3

Apache Cordova 3.3.0 and earlier and Adobe PhoneGap 2.9.0 and earlier
do not anchor the end of domain-name regular expressions, which allows
remote attackers to bypass a whitelist protection mechanism via a
domain name that contains an acceptable name as an initial substring.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2013-02/msg00035.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2013:0359
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2013-02/msg00025.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2013:0360
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2013-02/msg00026.html

Unspecified vulnerability in the ExternalInterface ActionScript
functionality in Adobe Flash Player before 10.3.183.67 and 11.x before
11.6.602.171 on Windows and Mac OS X, and before 10.3.183.67 and 11.x
before 11.2.202.273 on Linux, allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code via crafted SWF content, as exploited in the wild in
February 2013.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

11.7.700.275 and 11.8.x through 13.0.x before 13.0.0.182 on Windows
and OS X and before 11.2.202.350 on Linux, Adobe AIR before 13.0.0.83
on Android, Adobe AIR SDK before 13.0.0.83, and Adobe AIR SDK &
Compiler before 13.0.0.83 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary
web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2014-09/msg00021.html

Adobe Flash Player before 13.0.0.244 and 14.x and 15.x before
15.0.0.152 on Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.406 on Linux, Adobe
AIR before 15.0.0.249 on Windows and OS X and before 15.0.0.252 on
Android, Adobe AIR SDK before 15.0.0.249, and Adobe AIR SDK & Compiler
before 15.0.0.249 do not properly restrict discovery of memory
addresses, which allows attackers to bypass the ASLR protection
mechanism via unspecified vectors.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

15.0.0.223 on Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.418 on Linux, Adobe
AIR before 15.0.0.356, Adobe AIR SDK before 15.0.0.356, and Adobe AIR
SDK & Compiler before 15.0.0.356 allow attackers to execute arbitrary
code by leveraging an unspecified "type confusion," a different
vulnerability than CVE-2014-0577, CVE-2014-0584, CVE-2014-0585, and
CVE-2014-0586.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-1881
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-1881
Phase: Assigned (20140207)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20140124 Security Vulnerabilities in Apache Cordova / PhoneGap
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2014/Jan/96
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20140207 Re: CVE request: multiple issues in Apache Cordova/PhoneGap
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/02/07/9
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/124954/apachecordovaphonegap-bypass.txt
Reference: MISC:http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~shmat/shmat_ndss14nofrak.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://www.internetsociety.org/ndss2014/programme#session3

Apache Cordova 3.3.0 and earlier and Adobe PhoneGap 2.9.0 and earlier
allow remote attackers to bypass intended device-resource restrictions
of an event-based bridge via a crafted library clone that leverages
IFRAME script execution and waits a certain amount of time for an
OnJsPrompt handler return value as an alternative to correct
synchronization.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Apache Cordova 3.3.0 and earlier and Adobe PhoneGap 2.9.0 and earlier
allow remote attackers to bypass intended device-resource restrictions
of an event-based bridge via a crafted library clone that leverages
IFRAME script execution and directly accesses bridge JavaScript
objects, as demonstrated by certain cordova.require calls.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-1883
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-1883
Phase: Assigned (20140207)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20140124 Security Vulnerabilities in Apache Cordova / PhoneGap
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2014/Jan/96
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20140207 Re: CVE request: multiple issues in Apache Cordova/PhoneGap
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/02/07/9
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/124954/apachecordovaphonegap-bypass.txt
Reference: MISC:http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~shmat/shmat_ndss14nofrak.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://www.internetsociety.org/ndss2014/programme#session3
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/phonegap/phonegap/blob/2.6.0/changelog

Adobe PhoneGap before 2.6.0 on Android uses the
shouldOverrideUrlLoading callback instead of the proper
shouldInterceptRequest callback, which allows remote attackers to
bypass intended device-resource restrictions via content that is
accessed (1) in an IFRAME element or (2) with the XMLHttpRequest
method by a crafted application.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-1884
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-1884
Phase: Assigned (20140207)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20140124 Security Vulnerabilities in Apache Cordova / PhoneGap
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2014/Jan/96
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20140207 Re: CVE request: multiple issues in Apache Cordova/PhoneGap
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/02/07/9
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/124954/apachecordovaphonegap-bypass.txt
Reference: MISC:http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~shmat/shmat_ndss14nofrak.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://www.internetsociety.org/ndss2014/programme#session3

Apache Cordova 3.3.0 and earlier and Adobe PhoneGap 2.9.0 and earlier
on Windows Phone 7 and 8 do not properly restrict navigation events,
which allows remote attackers to bypass intended device-resource
restrictions via content that is accessed (1) in an IFRAME element or
(2) with the XMLHttpRequest method by a crafted application.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-5333
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-5333
Phase: Assigned (20140818)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://miki.it/blog/2014/8/15/adobe-really-fixed-rosetta-flash-today/
Reference: CONFIRM:http://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/flash-player/apsb14-18.html

Adobe Flash Player before 13.0.0.241 and 14.x before 14.0.0.176 on
Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.400 on Linux, Adobe AIR before
14.0.0.178 on Windows and OS X and before 14.0.0.179 on Android, Adobe
AIR SDK before 14.0.0.178, and Adobe AIR SDK & Compiler before
14.0.0.178 do not properly restrict the SWF file format, which allows
remote attackers to conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks
against JSONP endpoints, and obtain sensitive information, via a
crafted OBJECT element with SWF content satisfying the character-set
requirements of a callback API, in conjunction with a manipulation
involving a '$' (dollar sign) or '(' (open parenthesis) character.
NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for
CVE-2014-4671.

to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors, a different
vulnerability than CVE-2014-8455 and CVE-2014-9165.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-0074
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-0074
Phase: Assigned (20141118)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS15-021
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS15-021
Reference: SECTRACK:1031889
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1031889

Adobe Font Driver in Microsoft Windows Server 2003 SP2, Windows Vista
SP2, Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8,
Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2, and Windows RT Gold and
8.1 does not properly allocate memory, which allows remote attackers
to cause a denial of service via a crafted (1) web site or (2) file,
aka "Adobe Font Driver Denial of Service Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-0087

URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-0087

Category: 
Reference: MS:MS15-021
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS15-021
Reference: SECTRACK:1031889
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1031889

SP2, Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8,
Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2, and Windows RT Gold and
8.1 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from
kernel memory, and possibly bypass the KASLR protection mechanism, via
a crafted font, aka "Adobe Font Driver Information Disclosure
Vulnerability," a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-0089.

16.0.0.257 on Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.429 on Linux, Adobe
AIR before 16.0.0.245 on Windows and OS X and before 16.0.0.272 on
Android, Adobe AIR SDK before 16.0.0.272, and Adobe AIR SDK & Compiler
before 16.0.0.272 allow attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a
denial of service (memory corruption) via unspecified vectors, a
different vulnerability than CVE-2015-0303.

an unspecified impact on other platforms, via unknown vectors, as
exploited in the wild in January 2015.

Adobe Flash Player before 13.0.0.281 and 14.x through 17.x before
17.0.0.169 on Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.457 on Linux does
not properly restrict discovery of memory addresses, which allows
attackers to bypass the ASLR protection mechanism via unspecified
vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-0357.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

17.0.0.169 on Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.457 on Linux allows
attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service
(memory corruption) via unspecified vectors, a different vulnerability
than CVE-2015-0347, CVE-2015-0350, CVE-2015-0352, CVE-2015-0353,
CVE-2015-0354, CVE-2015-0355, CVE-2015-0360, CVE-2015-3038,
CVE-2015-3042, and CVE-2015-3043.

Adobe Flash Player before 13.0.0.281 and 14.x through 17.x before
17.0.0.169 on Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.457 on Linux allows
attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service
(memory corruption) via unspecified vectors, as exploited in the wild
in April 2015, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-0347,
CVE-2015-0350, CVE-2015-0352, CVE-2015-0353, CVE-2015-0354,
CVE-2015-0355, CVE-2015-0360, CVE-2015-3038, CVE-2015-3041, and

======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-5119
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-5119
Phase: Assigned (20150626)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://blog.trendmicro.com/trendlabs-security-intelligence/unpatched-flash-player-flaws-more-pocs-found-in-hacking-team-leak/
Reference: MISC:http://twitter.com/w3bd3vil/statuses/618168863708962816
Reference: MISC:https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/132600/Adobe-Flash-Player-ByteArray-Use-After-Free.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/flash-player/apsa15-03.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/flash-player/apsb15-16.html
Reference: CERT:TA15-195A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/alerts/TA15-195A
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#561288
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/561288

Use-after-free vulnerability in the ByteArray class in the
ActionScript 3 (AS3) implementation in Adobe Flash Player 13.x through
13.0.0.296 and 14.x through 18.0.0.194 on Windows and OS X and 11.x
through 11.2.202.468 on Linux allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via
crafted Flash content that overrides a valueOf function, as exploited
in the wild in July 2015.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/shockwave/apsb15-17.html

Adobe Shockwave Player before 12.1.9.159 allows attackers to execute
arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via
unspecified vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-5120.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-5122
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-5122
Phase: Assigned (20150626)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2015/07/cve-2015-5122_-_seco.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/flash-player/apsa15-04.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/flash-player/apsb15-18.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:1235
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-1235.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:1255
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-07/msg00028.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:1258
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-07/msg00029.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:1267
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-07/msg00032.html
Reference: CERT:TA15-195A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/alerts/TA15-195A
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#338736
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/338736

Use-after-free vulnerability in the DisplayObject class in the
ActionScript 3 (AS3) implementation in Adobe Flash Player 13.x through
13.0.0.302 on Windows and OS X, 14.x through 18.0.0.203 on Windows and
OS X, 11.x through 11.2.202.481 on Linux, and 12.x through 18.0.0.204
on Linux Chrome installations allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via
crafted Flash content that leverages improper handling of the
opaqueBackground property, as exploited in the wild in July 2015.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Use-after-free vulnerability in the BitmapData class in the
ActionScript 3 (AS3) implementation in Adobe Flash Player 13.x through
13.0.0.302 on Windows and OS X, 14.x through 18.0.0.203 on Windows and
OS X, 11.x through 11.2.202.481 on Linux, and 12.x through 18.0.0.204
on Linux Chrome installations allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via
crafted Flash content that overrides a valueOf function, as exploited
in the wild in July 2015.

Compiler before 18.0.0.199 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code
via unspecified vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-5127,
CVE-2015-5130, CVE-2015-5134, CVE-2015-5539, CVE-2015-5540,
CVE-2015-5550, CVE-2015-5551, CVE-2015-5557, CVE-2015-5559,
CVE-2015-5561, CVE-2015-5563, CVE-2015-5564, and CVE-2015-5565.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-5571
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-5571
Phase: Assigned (20150717)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/flash-player/apsb15-23.html

Adobe Flash Player before 18.0.0.241 and 19.x before 19.0.0.185 on
Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.521 on Linux, Adobe AIR before
19.0.0.190, Adobe AIR SDK before 19.0.0.190, and Adobe AIR SDK &
Compiler before 19.0.0.190 do not properly restrict the SWF file
format, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site request
forgery (CSRF) attacks against JSONP endpoints, and obtain sensitive
information, via a crafted OBJECT element with SWF content satisfying
the character-set requirements of a callback API.  NOTE: this issue
exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-4671 and
CVE-2014-5333.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: CONFIRM:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/acrobat/apsb15-24.html

10.1.16 and 11.x before 11.0.13, Acrobat and Acrobat Reader DC Classic
before 2015.006.30094, and Acrobat and Acrobat Reader DC Continuous
before 2015.009.20069 on Windows and OS X allows attackers to obtain
sensitive information from process memory via invalid arguments, a
different vulnerability than CVE-2015-6697, CVE-2015-6699,
CVE-2015-6700, CVE-2015-6701, CVE-2015-6702, and CVE-2015-6704.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.535 on Linux, Adobe AIR before
19.0.0.213, Adobe AIR SDK before 19.0.0.213, and Adobe AIR SDK &
Compiler before 19.0.0.213 allow attackers to execute arbitrary code
or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via unspecified
vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-7625, CVE-2015-7626,
CVE-2015-7627, CVE-2015-7630, and CVE-2015-7634.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)
